newsitem.title: UK: Bank of England reappoints banking supervisor.
newsitem.headline: Bank of England reappoints banking supervisor.

text.p: The Bank of England said on Monday it had reappointed Harry Taylor as an independent member of the Board of Banking Supervision, effective today.

The Board advises Bank of England Governor Eddie George on supervision of financial institutions, development of supervisory practice, administration of banking legislation and training of bank supervisors.
Taylor was first appointed to the Board in 1987.
